toolbox.name: 3D Analyst
toolbox.summary: Use the ArcGIS 3D Analyst geoprocessing tools to create, modify, and analyze TIN, raster, and terrain surfaces, then extract information and features from them. The 3D Analyst toolsets let you convert TINs to features and rasters; create 3D features from functional surfaces by extracting height information; interpolate information from rasters; mathematically manipulate rasters; reclassify rasters; and derive height, slope, aspect, and volumetric information from TINs and rasters.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Use the ArcGIS 3D Analyst geoprocessing tools to create, modify, and analyze TIN, raster, and terrain surfaces, then extract information and features from them. The 3D Analyst toolsets let you convert TINs to features and rasters; create 3D features from functional surfaces by extracting height information; interpolate information from rasters; mathematically manipulate rasters; reclassify rasters; and derive height, slope, aspect, and volumetric information from TINs and rasters.
